dump.description:
Returns a simple string representation of the object or array.
Other types of objects will be returned unprocessed.  Arrays
are expected to be indexed.  Use object notation for
associative arrays.
If included, the dump method is added to the YUI instance.
dump.name: dump

widget-stack.description: Provides stackable (z-index) support for Widgets through an extension.
widget-stack.name: widget-stack

substitute.description:
String variable substitution and string formatting.
If included, the substitute method is added to the YUI instance.
substitute.name: substitute

loader.name: Loader
loader.description:
Loader dynamically loads script and css files.  It includes the dependency
info for the version of the library in use, and will automatically pull in
dependencies for the modules requested.  It supports rollup files and will
automatically use these when appropriate in order to minimize the number of
http connections required to load all of the dependencies.  It can load the
files from the Yahoo! CDN, and it can utilize the combo service provided on
this network to reduce the number of http connections required to download 
YUI files.

get.name: Get
get.description: Fetches and inserts one or more script or link nodes into the document

console.description: A user interface for viewing log messages.
console.name: console

overlay.description:
Provides a basic Overlay widget, with Standard Module content support. The Overlay widget
provides Page XY positioning support, alignment and centering support along with basic 
stackable support (z-index and shimming).
overlay.name: overlay

widget-position.description: Provides basic XY positioning support for Widgets, though an extension
widget-position.name: widget-position

json.description:
The JSON Utility provides methods to serialize JavaScript objects into JSON strings and parse JavaScript objects from strings containing JSON data. Three modules are available for inclusion:
  1. 1. json-parse for parsing JSON strings into native JavaScript data
  2. 2. json-stringify for stringification of JavaScript objects into JSON strings
  3. 3. json for both parsing and stringification
Both json-parse and json-stringify create functions in a static JSON class under your YUI instance (e.g. Y.JSON.parse(..)).

json-stringify.name: JSON
json-stringify.description: Provides Y.JSON.stringify method for converting objects to JSON strings.

json-parse.name: JSON
json-parse.description:
Provides Y.JSON.parse method to take JSON strings and return native
JavaScript objects.

json.name: json

dd-plugin.description: This is a simple Drop plugin that can be attached to a Node via the plug method.

dd-drop-plugin.name: DropPlugin
dd-drop-plugin.description: This is a simple Drop plugin that can be attached to a Node via the plug method.

dd-plugin.name: DragPlugin
dd-plugin.description: This is a simple Drag plugin that can be attached to a Node via the plug method.

dd-plugin.name: dd-plugin

node-menunav.description:
The MenuNav Node Plugin makes it easy to transform existing list-based markup into traditional, drop down navigational menus that are both accessible and easy to customize, and only require a small set of dependencies.

To use the MenuNav Node Plugin, simply pass a reference to the plugin to a Node instance's plug method.

var oMenuNav = Y.Node.get("#productsandservices");
oMenuNav.plug(Y.plugin.NodeMenuNav);

The MenuNav Node Plugin has several configuration properties that can be set via an object literal that is passed as a second argument to a Node instance's plug method.

var oMenuNav = Y.Node.get("#productsandservices");
oMenuNav.plug(Y.plugin.NodeMenuNav, { mouseOutHideDelay: 1000 });

The complete list of the MenuNav Node Plugin configuration properties are:

useARIA
Boolean indicating if use of the WAI-ARIA Roles and States should be enabled for the MenuNav. Set to true by default for Firefox 3 and Internet Explorer 8 as currently only these browsers have support for ARIA, and are supported by several screen readers for Windows that also offer support for ARIA.
autoSubmenuDisplay
Boolean indicating if submenus are automatically made visible when the user mouses over the menu's items. Set to true by default.
submenuShowDelay
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should expire before a submenu is made visible when the user mouses over the menu's label. Set to 250 by default.
submenuHideDelay
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should expire before a submenu is hidden when the user mouses out of a menu label heading in the direction of a submenu. Set to 250 by default.
mouseOutHideDelay
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should expire before a submenu is hidden when the user mouses out of it. Set to 750 by default.
node-menunav.name: node-menunav

mock.description: Mock objects for JavaScript and YUI Test.
mock.name: mock

node.description: The Node Utility provides a DOM-like interface for interacting with DOM nodes.

node.name: Node
node.description: Extended Node interface for managing classNames.

node-base.name: Drag
node-base.description: This class provides an abstraction for manipulating DOM nodes.

node-screen.name: Node
node-screen.description:
Extended Node interface for managing regions and screen positioning.
Adds support for positioning elements and normalizes window size and scroll detection.

node-style.name: Node
node-style.description: Extended Node interface for managing node styles.

node.name: node

widget.description: Provides the base Widget class along with an augmentable PluginHost interface
widget.name: widget

anim-node-plugin.name: Anim
anim-node-plugin.description: Binds an Anim instance to a Node instance

anim-scroll.name: Anim
anim-scroll.description: Adds support for the scroll property in to and from attributes.

anim-xy.name: Anim
anim-xy.description: Adds support for the xy property in from and to attributes.

anim-color.name: Anim
anim-color.description: Adds support for color properties in to and from attributes.

anim-curve.name: Anim
anim-curve.description: Adds support for the curve property for the to attribute. A curve is zero or more control points and an end point.

anim-easing.name: Easing
anim-easing.description:
The easing module provides methods for customizing
how an animation behaves during each run.

dd.description: Extends the dd-ddm Class to add support for the placement of Drop Target shims inside the viewport shim. It also handles all Drop Target related events and interactions.

dd-ddm-drop.name: DDM
dd-ddm-drop.description: Extends the dd-ddm Class to add support for the placement of Drop Target shims inside the viewport shim. It also handles all Drop Target related events and interactions.

dd-constrain.name: DragConstrained
dd-constrain.description:
This class extends the dd-drag module to add the constraining methods to it. It supports constraining to a region, node or viewport. It also
supports tick based moves and XY axis constraints.

dd-drop.name: Drop
dd-drop.description: This class provides the ability to create a Drop Target.

dd-ddm.name: DDM
dd-ddm.description:
Extends the dd-ddm-base Class to add support for the viewport shim to allow a draggable node to drag to be dragged over an iframe or any other node that traps mousemove events.
It is also required to have Drop Targets enabled, as the viewport shim will contain the shims for the Drop Targets.

dd-drag.name: Drag
dd-drag.description: This class provides the ability to drag a Node.

dd-proxy.name: Proxy
dd-proxy.description: This class extends dd-drag to allow for creating a proxy drag node, instead of dragging the original node.

dd-ddm-base.name: DDM
dd-ddm-base.description: Provides the base Drag Drop Manger required for making a Node draggable.

dd.name: dd

assert.description: Assertion library for JavaScript and YUI Test.
assert.name: assert

slider.description:
Create a sliding value range input visualized as a draggable thumb on a
background element.
slider.name: slider

base.description:
Base class support for objects requiring
managed attributes and acting as event targets
base.name: base

oop.description: OOP utils.  If included, the OOP methods are added to the YUI instance
oop.name: oop

widget-stdmod.description: Provides standard module support for Widgets through an extension.
widget-stdmod.name: widget-stdmod

widget-position-ext.description:
Provides extended/advanced XY positioning support for Widgets, through an extension.
It builds on top of the widget-position module, to provide alignmentment and centering support.
Future releases aim to add constrained and fixed positioning support.
widget-position-ext.name: widget-position-ext

dom.description: Add style management functionality to DOM.

selector.description: Provides helper methods for collecting and filtering DOM elements.

dom-style.name: DOM
dom-style.description: Add style management functionality to DOM.

dom-screen.name: DOM
dom-screen.description: Adds position and region management functionality to DOM.

dom.name: dom

plugin.description: Provides the base Plugin class for building widget plugins.
plugin.name: plugin

classnamemanager.description:
Contains a singleton (ClassNameManager) that enables easy creation and caching of 
prefixed class names.
classnamemanager.name: classnamemanager

queue.description:
Mechanism to execute a series of callbacks in a non-blocking queue. Each callback is executed via setTimout unless configured with a negative timeout, in which case it is run in blocking mode in the same execution thread as the previous callback. Callbacks can be function references or object literals with the following keys:
  • fn - {Function} REQUIRED the callback function.
  • timeout - {number} millisecond delay to wait after previous callback completion before executing this callback. Negative values cause immediate blocking execution. Default 0.
  • until - {Function} boolean function executed before each iteration. Return true to indicate callback completion.
  • iterations - {Number} number of times to execute the callback before proceeding to the next callback in the queue. Incompatible with until.
queue.name: queue
